data.question: What is the title of the article?
data.answer: Ultrafast Luminescent Light-Up Guest Detection Based on the Lock of the Host Molecular Vibration

data.question: Who are the authors of the article?
data.answer: Chun-Yu Liu, Xu-Ran Chen, Hui-Xian Chen, Zheng Niu, Hajime Hirao, Pierre Braunstein, and Jian-Ping Lang

data.question: What is the DOI of the article?
What type of material is discussed for luminescent light-up guest detection?
What is the main advantage of the guest-lock-induced luminescence enhancement mechanism?
data.answer: It allows for ultrafast light-up detection of target VOCs with high sensitivity and specificity.

data.question: What computational method was used for the study?
What is the empirical formula of the synthesized MOF [Cu4I4(Py3P)2]n?
Is the MOF discussed in the article water stable?
Did the MOF sensor achieve real-time detection of chlorobenzene?
What is the response time of the MOF sensor to CH2Cl2 vapor?
What is the role of chlorinated hydrocarbons in the MOF's mechanism?
data.answer: They lock the molecular vibrations within the MOF, leading to luminescence enhancement.

data.question: Was the MOF sensor able to selectively detect chlorobenzene among other VOCs?
What is the quantum yield (QY) of the MOF sensor when detecting CH2Cl2?
Can the MOF sensor be recycled without performance loss?
What is the significance of the ONIOM-DFT calculations in the study?
data.answer: They provide insights into the binding mechanism and differences in luminescence when different guest molecules are used.

data.question: Is the MOF sensor sensitive to moisture?
data.answer: No, it shows remarkably stable fluorescence performance even under ambient conditions.

data.question: What is the main limitation of the current light-up sensors mentioned in the article?
data.answer: Limited sensitivity for light-up detection and poor recycling performances.

data.question: What is the crystal system of the synthesized MOF?
Did the study employ single-crystal X-ray diffraction (SCXRD) analysis?
What is the potential application of the MOF sensor discussed in the article?
data.answer: Detection of toxic and environmentally hazardous VOCs like chloroalkanes.
